trans-unit.source: The fundamental goal of Windows PowerShell is providing better, easier administrative control over systems, either interactively or from script.
trans-unit.target: The fundamental goal of Windows PowerShell is providing better, easier administrative control over systems, either interactively or from script.

trans-unit.source: This chapter walks through solutions to many specific problems in administering Windows systems with Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This chapter walks through solutions to many specific problems in administering Windows systems with Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Although we have not talked about scripts or functions in the Windows PowerShell User's Guide, the solutions can be used from scripts or as functions later.
trans-unit.target: Although we have not talked about scripts or functions in the Windows PowerShell User's Guide, the solutions can be used from scripts or as functions later.

trans-unit.source: We will show examples that include functions as part of the solution to solve problems.
trans-unit.target: We will show examples that include functions as part of the solution to solve problems.

trans-unit.source: Throughout the solution descriptions, you will see a mix of solutions using specific cmdlets, the general Get-WmiObject cmdlet, and even external tools that are part of the Windows and .NET Framework infrastructures.
trans-unit.target: Throughout the solution descriptions, you will see a mix of solutions using specific cmdlets, the general Get-WmiObject cmdlet, and even external tools that are part of the Windows and .NET Framework infrastructures.

trans-unit.source: Use of external tools is part of the long-term design intent of Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Use of external tools is part of the long-term design intent of Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Even as the system grows, users will continually encounter situations in which the available toolsets do not do everything they need.
trans-unit.target: Even as the system grows, users will continually encounter situations in which the available toolsets do not do everything they need.

trans-unit.source: Rather than foster dependency on cmdlet implementations alone, Windows PowerShell tries to support integrating solutions from every possible alternative scenario.
trans-unit.target: Rather than foster dependency on cmdlet implementations alone, Windows PowerShell tries to support integrating solutions from every possible alternative scenario.
